questions.text: Who did Sam say was going to interview him on the radio?
questions.explanation:
Dave Richards.

	Dave Richards was on the show in an earlier season. He tried to get Diane to go out with him. Diane thought he was nothing more than an aging adolescent womanizer. In this episode he's not seen as Sam called into the radio station to do the interview.

questions.text: What did Woody ask Sam on the radio?
questions.correct: Where did you put the olives?
options: What was your favorite memory of playing with the Sox?
questions.explanation:
Where did you put the olives?.

	Sam yelled at him to get off the phone and Woody said that he said to ask anything. Woody is very naive and takes things too literally sometimes.

questions.text: How did Sam describe Diane on the radio?
questions.explanation:
love bunny.

	Diane took great offense at being called a love bunny on the air. She told Sam she didn't like being lumped in with all his other girlfriends.

questions.text: Who came to see Norm at Cheers?
questions.explanation:
Phyllis Henshaw.

	Phyllis Henshaw was played by Miriam Flynn. She is best known for who role as Cousin Catherine in the National Lampoon movies.

questions.text: Why did the woman come to see Norm?
questions.correct: She thought Vera and Ron were having an affair.
options: She and Norm were having an affair.
She wanted to go where everybody knows your name.
She wanted him to buy her a beer.
questions.explanation:
She thought Vera and Ron were having an affair.

	She said that Ron had been borrowing tools that he already had at their house. She said that Vera was attractive so she could see why Ron would be interested in her.

questions.text: Who do they hire as a detective?
questions.explanation:
Carla's cousin.

	Carla's cousin, Santo Carbone was played by Ernie Sabella who is best known as the voice of Pumbaa in "The Lion King" movies. He was born in 1949 in Westchester, NY.

questions.text: Why had Carla used the detective in the past?
questions.correct: to track down Diane in the insane asylum
options: to find out what her kids were doing while she was not with them
to find out Sam's likes and dislikes because she was in love with him
to track down Diane in the insane asylum
to try to find a reason to send Cliff to jail
questions.explanation:
to track down Diane in the insane asylum.

	Diane told Carla that it wasn't an insane asylum but a mental hospital where she could come and go as she pleased. Carla still said that Diane went nuts.

questions.correct: Vera and Ron were not having an affair.
options: Vera and Ron were secret spies for the CIA.
Vera and Ron were having an affair.
questions.explanation:
Vera and Ron were not having an affair.

	Vera and Ron had talked about having an affair with each other.  However, they both decided they couldn't cheat on them.

questions.text: What did Vera say about Norm?
questions.correct: that she loved Norm despite his flaws
options: that he was fat but loveable
that he didn't care about her but she loved him
questions.explanation:
that she loved Norm despite his flaws.

	Vera explained how Norm was at the bar more than he was home. She even said he wasn't good in bed, but despite everything she loved him and could never cheat on him.

questions.text: When Phyllis said, "In a strange way I actually like Vera." How did Norm respond?
questions.correct: "That's the only way you can like her."
options: "And in a strange way I actually like Ron."
"Vera's the best thing in my life."
questions.explanation:
"That's the only way you can like her."

	Norm loved his wife Vera very much and has expressed this to others a few times on the shows run. However, he often poked fun at his wife, and made comments to the others that would make one think he didn't care about his wife.
